Reviews.Title: “Okay for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: goochiemae
Reviews.Content: Our first room had a broken TV and the front desk clerk offered to move us to a different room. The room she gave us reeked of smoke, so we asked to be moved yet again. I was in the original room while my husband shuttled back and forth moving our belongings when the desk clerk came up to check on the TV. Initially she evidenced an attitude that seemed to indicate she thought I just didn't know how to turn on a TV. Once she ascertained that the TV was indeed broken, her attitude changed and she became friendly and helpful. The third room was clean and fine for our needs with a working TV. Sadly this hotel has paper thin walls. I was awakened around 1:00 am and again around 3:00 am by people coming and going in the halls. Breakfast was adequate. No fresh fruit and no yogurt--toast, cereal & waffles. OK but nothing to write home about. In all, I wouldn't stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: shaunbsc
Reviews.Content: Not a horrible place to stay. Was reasonably close to the Memphis area. Seemed to be in an undesirable neighborhood. I was worried about leaving my vehicle in the parking lot because there were plenty of people loitering in the surrounding property at midnight when I went to the next door gas station for a drink. Room wasn't that bad. Had a hard time working the AC, but it got the job done. Internet was good. Room was semi clean, stains on carpets - but what hotel doesnt have that. Toilet was broken, and had to be adjusted after every flush to prevent it from running loudly all night - something they obviously encounter every time they clean the room, but never bother to fix. I was on the top floor to avoid any family noise/disturbance. This didn't seem to work. There were older kids going through the hallways at all hours. At one point around 10pm one of them actually knocked at my door only to say "whoops wrong room" and walk away when I answered. Breakfast was lousy. Standard continental breakfast with a waffle maker. Waffles were gross, tasted sour, like the batter had gone bad. Breakfast was also supposed to start at 6am, but when I went down to the area it was still being set up by the front desk worker and it wasn't ready til about 6:20. I also found out that my checkout receipt showed a double charge for the room. I had to speak with the manager to get the issue corrected and verified that my account would not be overcharged. Because of the hassles, I probably wouldn't stay here again. When I am business traveling I just want to relax and not worry about little things. It was a pain having to fix the toilet after every flush and play with the thermostat every 30 minutes to keep the room comfortable. I usually like to be out the door by 7am, so waiting for breakfast to be set up was also inconvenient. I also shouldn't have to worry about my credit card getting double charged or my vehicle being stolen/broken in to. In the future I'll spend the extra 20 and stay at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyDDS
Reviews.Content: Booked on the website. Correct reservation. Engaging, helpful staff. Three floors with inside corridors, and elevator and baggage cart. The king bed rooms are more than the double doubles, so reserved the double double eventhough we only needed on bed. I believe this a mistake. This is a noisy place with thin walls and floor/ceilings. You want to be on the top floor with the business people, not on the bottom with the families. Very noisy until 1am. Lucky there were no late night TV watchers around. I would try it again on the third floor because the alternatives at this exit have pretty bad reviews. Great breakfast with waffle machine and hard boiled eggs in addition to the usual cold cereal and breads.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay at the Baymont again.”
Reviews.Author: Joyce31
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Baymont were extremely helpful to tourists who did not know the city. They were kind and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Dining area was large enough to accommodate families easily.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied and Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kwbjkb
Reviews.Content: We were with a group so unfortunately, I couldn't switch hotels and had to endure for a week. My biggest concern was that the hotel wasn't clean. I am still trying to wash the dirt out of our socks from walking on the filthy carpet. There was hair in one of the beds when we arrived, so since there was no one available to change the sheets, I simply did it myself. They obviously do not put any focus on hotel improvements since the furniture was very old, our door was broken and uneven, the TV couldn't even get NBC, as well as many other things. The free breakfast was the best thing about the hotel and the staff seemed friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An alright stay”
Reviews.Author: travelling_cdn_girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights it was alright considering that I was not there for the hotel, all I needed was a place to sleep and was there for the attractions in Memphis. The attractions are located mostly in downtown Memphis. If you do not mind the the drive from the East Memphis ( where the hotel is) to downtown, then its okay. But, if you do, I would recommend booking a hotel either in downtown Memphis (if you don't mind paying, but everything is only a walk away) or stay in West Memphis which is only 15 min drive from downtown. The room was average and dirty. Our very first night, we found a huge yellow stain on the bedspread and well, we never used the blanket it ended up in the corner for the whole time that we were there. The shower curtain had stains on them, and showerhead was not appealing either. The floor was dirty, the room size was decent but if you had lots of luggage, you didn't have enough room to move around. Our door would not shut properly, so everytime you opened the door or closed it , you would have to double checked making sure it was completely closed and locked. The only thing that I found nice about this hotel was the sink. It was actually nice had you had lots of counter space. Everything in the hotel needs work or at least some updating. I don't think I would stay at this hotel again, and its a toss up for recommending to others because the price was right for a night. Other then updating the rooms, the hospitality was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: OnlyHighways
Reviews.Content: First collection of hotels you hit upon arriving in Memphis from the East. Not too far from downtown but probably a better deal since not right next to Graceland. The rooms are much better than the exterior and lobby suggest! Front desk very helpful and friendly. Has all the amenities: coffee maker, blow dryer, wireless internet (that works), and Showtime. Above average furniture with average bed makings. Seems like an old building with thinner walls but the hotel was quiet all night.

Reviews.Title: “Two words: bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: jh38501
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, and was extremely helpful. But the biggest memory-maker was the bed bug I found crawling across me during the night. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but needs work”
Reviews.Author: mizzou43
Reviews.Content: The staff on check-in was quite courteous. A few minutes after getting to my room, they even called to see if everything was satisfactory. After a six hour drive, all I wanted to do was take a nap so it seemed that everything would be alright. It would be later on that I started to notice small things that would take some of the gloss of my initial impression. The carpeting of the room is in dire need of replacement. It has managed to stretch and appears to be bunched up in places. There are, what appear to be, stains that either could not/were not removable. When I searched for a telephone directory, the only directory that was available was the white pages that had businesses available only if you knew the name of the business. The instruction card on the telephone was incorrect is stating that you were to dial #8 to get an outside number instead of #9 as was instructed by the front desk staff. The final straw was on the final morning of my stay when I discovered a multi-legged insect crawling across the nightstand. This property, from the outside, looks to be in good condition. However, good looks can be deceiving. It just needs a bit of help to be what I expected of this company. I have stayed at other properties owned by this company. However, this experience has left a bad memory for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Business-traveler4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice for a week at a time in March and May. The rates are decent if you have a coupon from the Travel Guide or they are running a special; between $55-75 a night for a room with two beds. The area is decent and well-lighted. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good for a continental breakfast complete with juice, coffee, muffins, different types of breads and cereals, bagels, hard boiled eggs and yogurt. The exercise room is nice with a treadmill, stairmaster, exercise bike and TV. If you are allergic to pets or cigarette smoke, be sure to check your room before you rent as they allow both. Avoid the third floor especially if you are allergic to smoke. There is a nice Cracker Barrel across the street and several restaurants within blocks of the hotel. I've never tried the outdoor pool. The Internet connection can be a pain as it is sometimes slow and goes down. For the most part, this is a good hotel to stay at in the area. It is within 20 minutes of the downtown, seems a safer area, has a good staff, is mostly clean (they need to vacuum under the beds more), and good for the money. I've tried several other hotels in this area. The Drury in is really nice across the street but costs $89+ a night and above what I want to pay even if you get a hot breakfast and drinks and snacks in the evening. The Ramada Inn has issues. I tried to rent a room there once because I had a coupon and figured since it was a chain hotel it would be nice but after looking at four rooms (three of which smelled terrible and one where the lock was broken because it looked like someone forced the door with a crowbar) I decided to stay at the Baymont instead.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel! BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: BROUSEY
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty with stained carpets, holes in linens, and ants crawling everywhere. The second night of our stay (when we decided we had had enough) the plumbing stopped working. After first nights sleep I awoke with small bites all over my skin. Upon returning home my Dr. informed me I had bed bugs. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way but a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Anji Page
Reviews.Content: This hotel is someway out from downtown Memphis but if you donâ€™t mind an easy 20-30 minute drive in, itâ€™s a good place to stay. The room was large and airy and clean enough although Iâ€™m not sure the maids make much of an effort with bed making and folding towels but if youâ€™re not bothered about little things like this, itâ€™s OK. Continental breakfast was included â€“ toast, cereal, juice, coffee and waffles â€“ it was a good start to the day but if you want something more â€˜Americanâ€™ there is an IHOP, Waffle House and Perkins just on the next street. The swimming pool wasnâ€™t opened when we stayed but they were cleaning it and getting it ready for the summer. Complimentary wireless internet access was also available in the rooms. Memphis was great â€“ we went to Sun Records, Gracelands, the Gibson factory, the Rock and Soul Museum â€“ if you are a music fan these are places not to be missed. Also Beale Street was very lively. We were lucky enough to be there for the Memphis in May music festival and saw BB King and Bryan Adams. We took the car into town and were able to park really easily for about a dollar an hour. Itâ€™s very easy to drive around. I would be happy to give you more information if you want to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Baymont - Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the reviews it sounds good - dont be fooled. Theres no Restaurant and No Bar, although they did serve a buffet breakfast which was good. To get to the nearest Watering Hole/Restuarant (Ruby Tuesdays) (15 min walk)you have to cross a major road, and I mean MAJOR (its like crossing a race track). The rooms are clean and functional apart from the TV reception with left a lot to be desired. While I was there some college kids decided to play football in the corridor at 1 in the morning. Dont think I'll be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend...better hotels around”
Reviews.Author: pastrygirl
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was not happy with this hotel. It's right off the interstate, and there are some other hotels around, as well as many fast food places. I requested a non-smoking room, and the first one I was given smelled horrible, the window was actually open (don't know if they were airing it out?). Second room better, but still smelled, but I was too tired to try for a third. Felt like I was bothering girl at front desk who was on the phone while helping me. Hotel was noisy, not very clean at all, window didn't shut all the way, I was on the 2nd floor, but overall did not feel very safe. I stayed 2 nights, and everytime I went in or out there was a rock propping open the exterior door downstairs, which was supposed to be key access only. Limited television channels, but the included continental bfast was decent. I wouldn't recommend the hotel, many other around that look far nicer for probably around the same rate. Stay here stressed me out w/ the noise, smell, feeling unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but it's not too terrible for the price”
Reviews.Author: snowfaery5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I first booked our hotel at the Baymont by the airport. After reading all the scary reviews about it, we changed to this hotel. Well, this hotel seems like it's in a better spot then the other one. It's right off a main road near restaurants and lots of other hotels. We felt very safe here. The building itself is very old and nothing like the new Baymonts. We checked in fairly quickly and got to our room which looked like someone was staying in it. There were taco bell wrappers and drinks in the room, the ironing board was out, and the bed wasn't made properly. There was also visible mold growing in the bathroom. We talked to the girl at the desk and she immediately put us in a suite which was a lot bigger. She said we'd get compensated as well. This room was clean. The floors had stains on them and the toilet made noise every 15 min like water was flushing down it. It served it's purpose though since we were only there to sleep for two nights. When we checked out, we got one night free and was charged for the regular rate, not the rate for the suite. I thought that made up for everything. This place is very old and not quite taken care of but for the price it was okay. I probably wouldn't stay here again, but if you're just looking for somewhere to rest and you aren't staying more than a couple of days..this place is alright to stay at. It's close to downtown and restaurants. At least you know if something goes wrong they'll take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Best move I made”
Reviews.Author: vacate your home and travel
Reviews.Content: A change from our 1st choice hotel due to some not so good reviews, 4 days before arriving from Scotland U.K. I booked a Suite with a Double King and Sofa bed in the other room for our daughter. The Hotel was clean, with helpful staff, adequate breakfast. Easy access to all Memphis attractions. We stayed there for three nts of our holiday. I booked it on the back of reviews on this site, as I did for the other hotels on our break which included Charlotte (Best Western), New Orleans(Holiday Inn Express), Savannah(B.W.), Charleston(B.W.), and finally Myrtle Beach(B.W.). The Baymont east set a good the standard for the rest of our break. Hope this assists others visiting Memphis

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Without a High Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel property and room was nice and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. There are several restaurants nearby. I was traveling with my pet and the staff gave me no problems at all (and no pet deposit!). The only non-positive thing I can say about this hotel was that the air freshener was a little too strong.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relax Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend in November and I must say they have the best southern down home hospitality that you can get. The front desk is very helpful with finding activities to entertain you, and will actually give you written directions to what's going on in their Lovely City. They also give you a hot or cold breakfast if you like. It reminded me of the Embassy Suites, less the cost.

Reviews.Title: “excellent (for the price)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited in Nov. 2004 to do the british tourist thing. We thought it might be a bit far from town but it turned out to be only 15 min drive from all the attractions and was much better for parking than the downtown ones. Facilities more than adequate and smart after a recent refurb. The locality is quite modest but there are plenty of shops and restaurants on nearby Sycamore. Helpful staff (and apologetic after they tried to let our room to someone else whilst we were in it.) Would use Baymont again with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was pleasant”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTFF
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a room at this hotel and I must admit I was a little reluctant to stay after reading all of the horrible reviews on Tripadvisor about the Baymonts in Memphis. But, I have to say that my stay was very pleasant. Of course it's not an upscale hotel, but neither is the price, so there are some things that you just don't expect. I understand that renovations had been done this year. The lobby, dining area, and our room were all nicely decorated. The room was clean and the employees were very helpful and attentive to our needs. My husband commented that their shower felt better than ours at home (consistent hot and powerful water). The complimentary breakfast was well stocked and quite handy if you're looking for something quick to jumpstart your day. When there was a request or problem, they were quick to assist. Only issues I had was the ceiling tile in a few places in the hallways had come down (probably a plumbing problem) and our bedspread was stained (but housekeeping changed it immediately after I asked). It's not the best hotel I've ever stayed in, but certainly not the worst. I would recommend it for those who are on a budget, but want a clean, safe place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Baymont Inn & Suites Memphis East
HotelInfo.Address: 6020 Shelby Oaks Drive, Memphis, TN 38134-7405
